rules: Rule1: Either the EPA has approved research funding for the climate study or the EPA has approved research funding for the biodiversity survey.

Rule21: The traditional approach has been maintained by the EPA or, if it is not the case that either private funding has been secured for the climate study or government funding has been allocated for the climate study, and alternative funding has been approved for the climate study, then an alternative methodology has been adopted by the EPA.

Rule27: Under the condition that backup funding has been arranged for the climate study, then if it is not the case that either private funding has been secured for the climate study or government funding has been allocated for the climate study, alternative funding has been approved for the climate study.

Rule37: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either equipment is functional in the Arctic region or if data collection has been completed in the Arctic region then samples have been processed in the Arctic region, then technical assistance has not been dispatched to the Arctic region, then emergency repair has not been completed in the Arctic region.
